Description: The Temptation of St Antony. The saint lying on the floor in foreground, assailed by several demonic creatures; counterproof of second state with artist's name; after Camilo Procaccini Mezzotint
Curator's comments: For counterproof see 1874,0808.1034. After Camillo Procaccini's monochrome drawing in the BM, 1928,0618.10.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (219)
Chaloner Smith 1883 / British Mezzotinto portraits from the introduction of the art to the early part of the present century (undescribed)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
